Class Battleship

  • java.lang.Object
    • Battleship

  • public class Battleship
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Battleship()
      Default constructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean computerCheckCoordinates(java.lang.String coordinates)
      Checks whether the coordinates randomly selected by the computer are valid.
      void computerPlace()
      Places the computer's ships and grenades in the array randomly -using the randomSelection method- and initializes the array of Position objects accordingly.
      void computerTurn()
      Simulates the computers's -turn using the randomSelection- checks the validity of the coordinates of computer rocket -using the computerCheckCoordinates method- and then checks whether the object in that position is already owned and if it is, the type of that object.
      void displayGrid()
      Initializes the rest of the array after players place their ships and grenades with objects of type Position.
      void gameEnd()
      Checks the number of ships for both players at the end of each turn to check if the game if all ships have been destroy to end the game.
      boolean humanCheckCoordinates(java.lang.String coordinates)
      Checks whether the coordinates supplied by the user are valid, and prints the appropriate responses if not.
      void humanPlace()
      Places the ships and grenades in the array according to the user's choice.
      void initialize()
      Initializes the rest of the array after players place their ships and grenades with objects of type Position.
      java.lang.String randomSelection()
      Random selection of coordinates for the computer to place ships and grenades or fire rockets.
      void runGame()
      Runs the game of battleship by placing the user army -using the humanPlace method- and placing the computer army -using the computerPlace method-.
      void userTurn()
      Simulates the user's turn.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Battleship

        public Battleship()
        Default constructor. Creates a 2D array of objects of type Position where the players will set their ships and grenades.

    • Method Detail

      • humanPlace

        public void humanPlace()
        Places the ships and grenades in the array according to the user's choice. This method asks for the user input, checks the validity of the input -using the humanCheckCoordinates method- and initializes the array of Position objects accordingly.
        See Also:
        humanCheckCoordinates

      • computerPlace

        public void computerPlace()
        Places the computer's ships and grenades in the array randomly -using the randomSelection method- and initializes the array of Position objects accordingly. This method randomly selects a position in the array, checks the validity of the input -using the computerCheckCoordinates method- and loops until the coordinates are valid.
        See Also:
        randomSelection, computerCheckCoordinates

      • randomSelection

        public java.lang.String randomSelection()
        Random selection of coordinates for the computer to place ships and grenades or fire rockets.
        Returns:
        the randomly selected coordinates as an object of type String

      • humanCheckCoordinates

        public boolean humanCheckCoordinates(java.lang.String coordinates)
        Checks whether the coordinates supplied by the user are valid, and prints the appropriate responses if not.
        Parameters:
        coordinates - an object of type String
        Returns:
        a boolean value

      • computerCheckCoordinates

        public boolean computerCheckCoordinates(java.lang.String coordinates)
        Checks whether the coordinates randomly selected by the computer are valid.
        Parameters:
        coordinates - an object of type String
        Returns:
        a boolean value

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Initializes the rest of the array after players place their ships and grenades with objects of type Position.

      • displayGrid

        public void displayGrid()
        Initializes the rest of the array after players place their ships and grenades with objects of type Position.

      • userTurn

        public void userTurn()
        Simulates the user's turn. Checks the validity of the coordinates of user rocket -using the humanCheckCoordinates method- and then checks whether the object in that position is already owned and if it is, the type of that object. If a ship is present, it updates the counter on the ships, while if a grenade is present it will update the counter on the missed turns and ensures a missed turn. Displays the grid at the end of the turn -using the displayGrid method-.
        See Also:
        humanCheckCoordinates, displayGrid

      • computerTurn

        public void computerTurn()
        Simulates the computers's -turn using the randomSelection- checks the validity of the coordinates of computer rocket -using the computerCheckCoordinates method- and then checks whether the object in that position is already owned and if it is, the type of that object. If a ship is present, it updates the counter on the ships, while if a grenade is present it will update the counter on the missed turns and ensures a missed turn. Displays the grid at the end of the turn -using the displayGrid method-.
        See Also:
        computer CheckCoordinates, randomSelection, displayGrid

      • gameEnd

        public void gameEnd()
        Checks the number of ships for both players at the end of each turn to check if the game if all ships have been destroy to end the game. Displays the number of missed turns in the case of game end.

      • runGame

        public void runGame()
        Runs the game of battleship by placing the user army -using the humanPlace method- and placing the computer army -using the computerPlace method-. Initializes the rest of the array -using the initialize method- and displays the grid for the start of the game -using the displayGrid method-.
        See Also:
        humanPlace, computerPlace, initialize, displayGrid
